text: Outputs the stage as it is at a different point in the timeline.
This cooks the nodes in its input chain at a different time than the current time in Houdini’s timeline. You can use this to grab animated values from the past or future.
There are two kinds of time-dependence in Solaris:
: parameters on the LOPs that generate the stage may have keyframe animation or expressions driven by the current frame/time.
: USD attributes can have animation stored as time samples.
options give you independent control of timeshifting the two different forms of animation.
